channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023110574
item.description:
Report E-2023110574

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetone was dented by an operator and released approximately fifteen (15) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed granular absorbents to the acetone impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110531
item.description:
Report E-2023110531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN1210 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized oil dry and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All spent oil dry and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the two (2) damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110813
item.description:
Report X-2023110813

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was on QA rollers at beginning of AM sort with an inspection required scan (usual process and placement of pkg for us). Sr QA Admin inspected pkg, cutting it open and pulling out all 4 cans; no evidence of leakage but all 4 cans were dented. Pkg put back into sort. Wet bottom on pkg found on 200 belt and was sent to QA. When starting to complete HESS, QA found the UN # on OP-900 did not match the UN # on the cans. Paperwork shows UN1133 (adhesive); can labels show UN1123 (a thinner) which is consistent with the odor of the leakage. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 cans were heavily dented along the bottom seams. Both had pinhole leaks on the bottom. No punctures visible on bottom of shipping box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg place in plastic tote. QA person opened box and turned the 2 leaking cans upside down to stop the seepage.

item.title: Report E-2023110320
item.description:
Report E-2023110320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Terminal reports a spill inside trailer OA3086, pro 722679732. (1) 55-G drum of white printing ink arrived on a faulty pallet. The pallet had broke and punctured the drum in transit, (1) pt. released to the pallet. The drum was flipped to prevent more from leaking, no impact to trailer, dock, environment, or waterways. The spill was cleaned and all materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110505
item.description:
Report E-2023110505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1993 was punctured by the shipper and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released product, and they swept them in with hand tools. The contents of the damaged 275-gallon tote were successfully transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote to be shipped to its next destination. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110106
item.description:
Report X-2023110106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA area in a black bin with a plastic liner. Package was leaking yellow paint. DescribePack: Package was crushed and leaking paint. Inside, four 1-gallon cans were dented and spilled yellow paint into package. Cans were packed in packing paper. Cans had multiple body failures and dents, and the tops to their lids were open and leaking. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a black bin with a plastic liner.

item.title: Report X-2023110126

Report X-2023110126

  • City: EAU CLAIRE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was located at trailer as it was being unloaded with a wet spot on the top side, then Qa was informed, which we then put on gloves and took it to the hazmat cage, where we completed the process for damaged hazmats. DescribePack: Outer package was still fully intact as well as inner packing DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a black bin and faced with orientation arrows upright

item.title: Report E-2023110056
item.description:
Report E-2023110056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee was offloading a trailer at Veolia's facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when a leaking container was discovered. An IBC full of inner packages containing paint had leaked about 1 gallon of liquid onto the floor of the trailer. The spill was cleaned up and reported to the EHS team. Upon investigation, it was found that several of the inner paint containers did not have lids or were not closed properly. The inner containers had also shifted during the transportation process.

item.title: Report X-2023101502
item.description:
Report X-2023101502

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT ON GREEN BELT THAT WAS LEAKING. SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED ALL OF THE BOTTLES HAD TAPE AROUND THE CAPS BUT ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP UNDER THE TAPE. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA area in a black bin with a plastic liner. Package was leaking white paint. DescribePack: Two 3.5-liter cans in the package were dented and were leaking from their tops. Closures on the paint cans were loose and falling off. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin with a plastic liner to contain the spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023101223
item.description:
Report X-2023101223

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE SOUTH INDUCT. AFTER IT WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, WAS DESCOVERED TO HAVE A DAMAGED AEROSOL CAN, AND NO LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS. THE OUTER PACKAGING WAS A USED BOX. THE RESPONDER THEN CALLED IT IN TO THE UPS HAZMAT LINE, CONFIRMED UNDECLARED.
